business.headline: From OTPs, KYC to e-Sign: How everyday slips are fuelling a new wave of digital fraudFraudsters no longer hack systems, they hack human behaviour, using lookalike pages, cloned voices and urgent prompts. Even routine steps like OTPs, KYC and e-Sign are becoming easy entry points. Are consumers prepared for this new kind of digital deception?
HUL's Nitin Paranjape shares dramatic account of company's 5-lakh store leapNitin Paranjpe recalled proposing the addition of five lakh outlets, a number he admitted sounded unrealistic at first.

Why is Zerodha's Nithin Kamath warning investors against pre-IPO hype?With IPO buzz at its peak, Nithin Kamath has stepped in to warn investors about the increasing speculation in the unlisted market, where many buyers are chasing inflated pre-IPO valuations.

How do you recover money after credit card fraud? Steps you must knowRecovering money after credit card fraud can feel stressful, but the process is simpler if you act quickly. Knowing the right steps — and your rights, can greatly improve your chances of getting your money back.

India's GDP rises by 8.2% in Q2 despite Trump tariffs, highest in six quartersIndia's 8.2% Q2 GDP print has beaten forecasts despite pressure from US tariffs, with manufacturing and services driving momentum and reaffirming the nation's place as the fastest-growing major economy heading into FY26.

Sensex, Nifty end flat as Dalal Street takes breather after hitting all-time highsThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 13.71 points to close at 85,706.67, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 12.60 points lower at 26,202.95. The broader market also remained subdued, with most major sectoral indices finishing in the red.

Are millennials relying too heavily on SIPs for wealth building?Millennials swear by SIPs for long term investing, but are they mistaking convenience for safety? As market cycles turn unpredictable, is it time to rethink what "safe investing" really means?

From tax deadlines to LPG, pensions: 5 major financial changes starting December 1Before December begins, it's worth noting that several new financial rules will kick in, affecting your bills, savings and even travel plans. Whether it's cooking gas, pension rules or tax filings, here's what to expect as the calendar turns.

Sudeep Pharma shares rise nearly 29% over IPO price. What should investors do?Sudeep Pharma's strong debut has impressed investors, but with valuations now stretched, is this the right moment to book profits or should investors stay put and ride the long-term story?

From GMP to price band: 5 things to know about Meesho IPOThe SoftBank-backed e-commerce platform has set a price band of Rs 105 to Rs 111 per share, valuing the company at nearly Rs 50,100 crore at the upper end.

Will your pension stop after November 30? Check nowThe deadline to submit the annual Life Certificate is almost here, and missing it could put your pension on hold. Pensioners must complete the process by 30 November to avoid any interruption.

New labour codes bring major employee benefits, but what are the big challenges?The new labour codes promise stronger protection and wider benefits for workers, but the real test begins now as businesses brace for higher costs, major restructuring and a challenging transition across sectors.

Why is tax department sending SMS alerts to 25,000 taxpayers about foreign assets?Tax officials examined data received from foreign jurisdictions through the Automatic Exchange of Information (AEOI) system. This international framework allows countries to share details of financial accounts held abroad by their residents.

Meesho IPO opening on December 3: What investors need to knowMeesho IPO is all set to open for subscription, backed by strong GMP cues and rising investor interest, but can the value-commerce giant turn pre-listing hype into sustained market performance? Here is all you need to know.

Is your money lying unclaimed? Here's how Delhi's new campaign help you recover itThe move is part of the Centre's ongoing 'Apki Punji, Apka Adhikar' campaign, which focuses on returning such funds to their rightful owners.

Sudeep Pharma makes strong market debut. Hold or book profit now?A blockbuster debut has rewarded Sudeep Pharma IPO investors. Should you cash out while sentiment is high or hold on for the company's expansion and export growth story?

Sudeep Pharma shares list at 23% premium in strong market debutThe Rs 895-crore issue, which was subscribed an extraordinary 93.71 times between November 21 and 25, opened at Rs 730 on the NSE and Rs 725 on the BSE, against the upper-end IPO price of Rs 593.

GAIL share price tumbles 6%. Here's why the PSU stock is falling todayThe slump in GAIL's share price reflects investor disappointment over a tariff hike that landed far below expectations. With a full review pushed to 2028, the market is recalibrating its outlook on earnings support for the PSU major.
Sensex, Nifty take breather after hitting record highsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 65.92 points at 85,786.30 around 9:22 am, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 16.65 points to 26,232.20.

entertainment.headline: BTS' V sparks buzz with 2025 Ford Mustang GTD photos, fans speculate price BTS V, also known as Taehyung, showcased a luxury car, a 2025 Ford Mustang GTD, to his followers on Instagram on November 28. The new car, spotted among photos of V spending time with friends, has drawn attention from fans and car enthusiasts alike.

Bigg Boss 19 Weekend Ka Vaar: Shehbaz Badesha evicted due to lack of votes Shehbaz Badesha has been evicted from 'Bigg Boss 19' due to a lack of votes. The grand finale of the reality show hosted by Salman Khan is scheduled for December 7.

Bigg Boss 19: Ashnoor Kaur reacts to sudden exit, says the show goes on Actor Ashnoor Kaur interacted with her followers on Instagram LIVE following her unexpected exit from 'Bigg Boss 19'. She reacted to her sudden exit, claims of an unfair exit and expressing gratitude to fans.

Bollywood producer's plea against cheque bouncing sentence dismissed The Mumbai Sessions Court has upheld the conviction of Bollywood producer Abdul Samee Siddiqui in a cheque bounce case. He has produced movies like 'Horn OK Please' and 'Halla Bol'.

Bharti Singh shares maternity photoshoot pics. Parineeti, Varun Dhawan react Comedian Bharti Singh surprised her fans and social media followers by sharing pictures from her maternity photoshoot. Actors Parineeti Chopra and Varun Dhawan, among others, have liked and commented on the post.

Sidhu Moose Wala's Barota hits 28M views, races to No 1 on YouTube in 48 hours Punjabi singer Sidhu Moose Wala's latest posthumous track 'Barota' has garnered over 28 million views on YouTube within 48 hours of release. The song has secured the number one spot on YouTube's music charts.

Abhishek's emotional post for Ashnoor after her eviction: You became my calm Abhishek Bajaj visited Ashnoor Kaur's home after her eviction from 'Bigg Boss 19'. He shared images, a video and a heartfelt note about her performance and their friendship during the show.

Judi Dench says she can't recognise people anymore due to vision loss Celebrated British actor Judi Dench, 90, has opened up about her worsening vision. She revealed that age-related macular degeneration has left her unable to recognise even close friends and colleagues.

Swara Bhasker's father-in-law suffers brain haemorrhage, undergoes surgery Swara Bhasker revealed that her father-in-law suffered a brain haemorrhage and underwent surgery early this morning. In an Instagram post, the actor requested prayers and privacy as the family navigates this difficult period.

The Girlfriend on OTT: When and where to watch Rashmika Mandanna's film Rahul Ravindran's directorial 'The Girlfriend', starring Rashmika Mandanna and Dheekshith Shetty, is set for its OTT premiere. The film received positive reviews during its theatrical run in early November.

Sophie Choudry schools troll questioning her Bollywood career: Such a sad mentality Sophie Choudry shut down trolls questioning her career after she shared photos with Jennifer Lopez from a billionaire wedding she hosted in Udaipur. The singer-host clarified that she has built a successful career through live shows and events, reminding critics that visibility on screen isn't the only measure of success.

Sidharth Malhotra on his daughter Saraayah's name and what makes it exotic Sidharth Malhotra shared the meaning behind his daughter Saraayah's name at a recent event. He further reflected on parenthood and praised his actor-wife, Kiara Advani.

Jaya Bachchan slams paparazzi's conduct, credibility: Who are these people? Jaya Bachchan has voiced strong criticism of the paparazzi. She distinguished journalists from photographers at public events and questioned the latter's conduct and credibility.

Rapper Bohemia pays tribute to Sidhu Moose Wala at latest Dubai concert. Watch Bohemia's emotional on-stage tribute to Sidhu Moose Wala went viral, moving fans and highlighting the deep respect between the two Punjabi music icons. The moment reignited love for their iconic collaboration "Same Beef" and reminded listeners of Moose Wala's lasting legacy.

Veteran Kannada actor MS Umesh dies at 80 after long battle with cancer Kannada actor MS Umesh, known for his iconic comic roles and decades-long contribution to the film industry, died on Sunday at the age of 84.

Manisha Koirala flaunts grey-hair look, fans call her true beauty Manisha Koirala impressed fans with her natural, no-makeup, greying-hair look during a recent airport appearance, drawing praise for her confidence and authenticity.

5 times Ariana and Cynthia broke the net with bizarre, cringe and confusing antics Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo delivered tons of unforgettable, meme-worthy moments during the Wicked: For Good press tour, from emotional interviews to bizarre red-carpet antics.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9 Highlights: Vijay Sethupathi roasts and warns FJ Vijay Sethupathi confronted FJ on Bigg Boss Tamil 9 for faking an injury, neglecting his captaincy duties, and manipulating Parvathi, leaving the contestant in tears. The host also slammed the housemates for misunderstanding the school task and pushed them to reflect through an anonymous-letter challenge.

Ranveer Singh faces backlash for mimicking Kantara's Chaundi scene at IFFI. Watch Ranveer Singh sparked controversy after mimicking a scene from Kantara Chapter 1 and referring to Chaundi as a "female ghost" during his stage act at IFFI 2024. His impression, which left Rishab Shetty laughing, has triggered a wave of criticism online for being "disrespectful" and insensitive to Daiva traditions.

general news.headline: Virat Kohli special drags India out of weeks-long Test gloom in Ranchi thrillerIndia vs South Africa: Senior batter Virat Kohli lit up a Super Sunday in Ranchi with a sublime 135, his 52nd ODI hundred, as India survived a tense finish to defend 18 runs in the final over and clinch a 17-run win in a last-over thriller.

US benefited from talented Indians: Musk on H-1B visa row, immigrationSpaceX and Tesla chief Elon Musk appeared on Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath's People by WTF podcast after days of speculation over his anticipated participation.

Virat Kohli or Sachin Tendulkar: Gavaskar picks his greatest ODI batterSunil Gavaskar hailed Virat Kohli as the greatest ODI batter after his 52nd hundred in Ranchi, saying even Ricky Ponting calls him the best he has seen and that surpassing Sachin Tendulkar leaves Kohli at the very top.

11 dead, 40 injured in head-on collision between two buses in Tamil NaduThe injured were taken to Sivagangai Government Hospital, and police have launched an investigation into the cause of the crash.

Who stole the colours of India?Ancient India was among the first to experiment with colours and dyed fabric was part of its prime exports. However, the west's fear of colours, India's colonial history and mindset, and the class bias associated with bright palettes are making India go colourless. Indians are taking to pastels, monochromes and neutral colours, for clothes, cars and buildings. Will Indians embrace their very own colours and make the dull world colourful?

Virat Kohli reacts to Test comeback rumours, says will continue to play only ODIsIND vs SA: India stalwart Virat Kohli shut down the growing buzz around a possible Test return himself during the post-match presentation of India's Ranchi ODI against South Africa.

Mumbai businesswoman stripped, molested at gunpoint, threatened with video leakA Mumbai businesswoman was allegedly stripped and assaulted at gunpoint by senior officials of a private company, who also filmed her.

Working will be optional in 10-15 years: Elon Musk on work-hours debateSpeaking on Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath's podcast People by WTF, Musk said this transformation could arrive in less than 20 years, may be as early as 10 to 15 years.

Coimbatore man kills wife, posts selfie with body calling it 'payment for betrayal'A man in Coimbatore allegedly killed his wife after suspecting her of an affair and then posted a chilling selfie with her body. Police arrested the accused, Balamurugan, soon after the incident and have begun an investigation.
Amazon's Siddharth Bhagat Breaks Down India's New Beauty Economy—From Global Trends to Tech-Led DiscoveryTracing India's changing beauty codes.

Gujarat woman's family kills her boyfriend, she 'marries' his corpseA man in Gujarat was allegedly shot dead by his girlfriend's family for opposing their relationship. Before the funeral, the woman applied vermilion near his body, demanding the death penalty for her own family.

SIR extended by 7 days in all states, draft electoral list to be out on December 16The Election Commission of India has extended the Special Intensive Revision schedule by a week in 12 States and Union Territories to ensure voters can verify their names in the electoral rolls. This move aims to enhance the accuracy and inclusiveness of voter lists ahead of upcoming elections.

Why Lord Ram's tallest statue has come up in party-paradise GoaIn Goa, where the magnet is sun, sand, and nightlife, a 77-foot bronze statue of Lord Ram was unveiled by PM Narendra Modi. It might seem unusual to many, but Lord Ram's statue in Goa is rooted in centuries of Dvaita Vaishnavism and the 550-year legacy of the Partagali Math. The statue is a symbol of faith and cultural resilience, as underlined by the PM.
From Serenity to Celebration - Gujarat in All Its ShadesAnother destination that has stood the test of time and modernisation is Vadnagar.

Congress troubleshoots after editorial defends Kerala MLA accused of sex assaultAn editorial in the Congress' Kerala mouthpiece Veekshanam defending suspended Palakkad MLA Rahul Mamkootathil sparked controversy. The article claimed Mamkootathil was a victim of a CPM conspiracy, prompting KPCC president Sunny Joseph to disown the piece and order corrections.

Haryana bodybuilder beaten to death for objecting to harassment of womenThe victim stopped a person named Rahul from making derogatory remarks towards women present at the wedding. As a result, Rahul, along with his friends, attacked him with lethal weapons.

Jagadish Chandra Bose built a radio before Marconi, but never took creditJagadish Chandra Bose pioneered early radio-wave detection and plant physiology, yet refused to patent his work, believing knowledge should be kept open for all. His science blended curiosity, ethics and invention, shaping wireless communication and plant research long before the world noticed. And he was the OG science fiction writer in Bengali too.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

China uses sedition charges to silence calls for fair probe into Hong Kong infernoChina is using sedition charges to suppress calls for transparency after the deadly Wang Fuk Court fire in Hong Kong. The tragedy, which killed 128 and left many missing, has intensified public anger and scrutiny of government oversight.

Cyclone Ditwah weakens into a deep depression, likely to fade further by tomorrow Live UpdatesExtremely heavy rain continues across many parts of Tamil Nadu as cyclonic storm Ditwah, which earlier devastated Sri Lanka, is getting closer to Tamil Nadu-Puducherry coast.

5 times Ariana and Cynthia broke the net with bizarre, cringe and confusing anticsAriana Grande and Cynthia Erivo delivered tons of unforgettable, meme-worthy moments during the Wicked: For Good press tour, from emotional interviews to bizarre red-carpet antics.

Bigg Boss 19 Weekend Ka Vaar: Shehbaz Badesha evicted due to lack of votesShehbaz Badesha has been evicted from 'Bigg Boss 19' due to a lack of votes. The grand finale of the reality show hosted by Salman Khan is scheduled for December 7.

Politics of harassment: Congress slams Centre after new FIR on Rahul, Sonia GandhiThe Congress has strongly reacted to the fresh FIR filed against Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi and others in the National Herald case, terming it as an example of the Centre's vendetta politics. The opposition alleges misuse of investigative agencies ahead of crucial elections.

Madhya Pradesh CM's son marries alongside 21 couples at Ujjain mass wedding eventThe CM's family opted for a modest celebration, with a simple invitation card, traditional processions and no lavish displays. The event, designed to promote simplicity and social harmony, saw 21 other couples also tying the knot.

Bollywood producer's plea against cheque bouncing sentence dismissedThe Mumbai Sessions Court has upheld the conviction of Bollywood producer Abdul Samee Siddiqui in a cheque bounce case. He has produced movies like 'Horn OK Please' and 'Halla Bol'.

Judi Dench says she can't recognise people anymore due to vision lossCelebrated British actor Judi Dench, 90, has opened up about her worsening vision. She revealed that age-related macular degeneration has left her unable to recognise even close friends and colleagues.

sports.headline: Virat and Rohit have made oppositions look silly, fun to see them: KL Rahul India skipper KL Rahul marvelled at how Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma can make opposition attacks look "silly", praising the stalwarts after their defining knocks in the first ODI against South Africa on Sunday.

Rohit, Kohli for 2027 World Cup: India coach says focus on enjoying their form now India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak dismissed speculation over Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's 2027 World Cup futures, insisting the team is focused on enjoying their current form after India's 17-run win in Ranchi.

IND vs SA: Aiden Markram proud of Jansen, Bosch's valiant fight in Ranchi thriller South Africa captain Aiden Markram expressed pride in his team's fightback despite a top-order collapse that left them chasing the match in their 17-run defeat to India in the first ODI in Ranchi. After crashing to 11 for 3, spirited innings from Marco Jansen, Matthew Breetzke and Corbin Bosch took the contest into the final over, reinforcing the Proteas' belief ahead of the next match.

India shock Iran 2-1 to seal 2026 AFC U17 Asian Cup qualification India's U17 side produced a brilliant comeback to defeat favourites Iran 2–1 in a must-win qualifier in Ahmedabad. The result sealed their spot in the 2026 AFC U17 Asian Cup, marking a major milestone for the squad.

India Beats South Africa by 17 Runs in First ODI as Virat Kohli Hits 52nd Century On this Special Report, the focus is on India's victory over South Africa in the first ODI of the three-match series in Ranchi. The speaker highlights Virat Kohli's return to form with his 52nd ODI century, noting it as a crucial performance for the team's confidence ahead of the 2027 World Cup. The report also mentions Kuldeep Yadav's four-wicket haul and Rohit Sharma's half-century as key factors in the 17-run win. The analysis underscores the importance of this victory following a recent Test series defeat.

India vs South Africa: Harshit Rana finds his length in ODIs Fast bowler Harshit Rana delivered a fiery opening spell against South Africa in Ranchi, finally offering a glimpse of why the Indian team management has persisted with him in the ODI setup. Playing just his 10th match, Rana bowled with purpose and clarity, justifying the faith invested in his raw pace and temperament.

Virat Kohli reacts to Test comeback rumours, says will continue to play only ODIs IND vs SA: India stalwart Virat Kohli shut down the growing buzz around a possible Test return himself during the post-match presentation of India's Ranchi ODI against South Africa.

Virat Kohli special drags India out of weeks-long Test gloom in Ranchi thriller India vs South Africa: Senior batter Virat Kohli lit up a Super Sunday in Ranchi with a sublime 135, his 52nd ODI hundred, as India survived a tense finish to defend 18 runs in the final over and clinch a 17-run win in a last-over thriller.

Steve Smith tests anti-glare eye patches ahead of pink-ball Gabba Test Australia's Steve Smith was seen using anti-glare eye black during a floodlit training session ahead of the crucial day-night Ashes Test at the Gabba, mirroring Shivnarine Chanderpaul's iconic look. Smith is searching for answers to visibility issues that have affected his pink-ball batting record, with hopes the new approach may offer an edge against England.

Zirkzee, Mount inspire Manchester United's comeback win at Crystal Palace Manchester United came from behind to beat Crystal Palace 2-1 at Selhurst Park, ending a five-year win drought. The victory boosts United's Premier League standing while raising concerns over Palace's congested schedule.

Shikha Pandey Sold To UP Warriorz For Rs 2.4 Crore In WPL 2026 Auction In this exclusive interview, veteran Indian pacer Shikha Pandey opens up about her move to UP Warriorz after being bought for Rs 2.4 crore in the WPL 2026 auction. Speaking to India Today, Pandey admits she was 'anxious' before the bidding but felt 'valued' by the price tag, which was the third-highest in the auction. She reflects on her time with Delhi Capitals, her close bond with former teammate Jemimah Rodrigues, and the origin of her nickname 'Shikipedia'. Pandey also discusses the growing importance of global franchise leagues like the WBBL and The Hundred for players who are not currently in the national team setup.

Virat Kohli reacts to Test comeback rumours, says will continue to play only ODIs IND vs SA: India stalwart Virat Kohli shut down the growing buzz around a possible Test return himself during the post-match presentation of India's Ranchi ODI against South Africa.

Smith is searching for answers to visibility issues that have affected his pink-ball batting record, with hopes the new approach may offer an edge against England.

She reflects on her time with Delhi Capitals, her close bond with former teammate Jemimah Rodrigues, and the origin of her nickname 'Shikipedia'. Pandey also discusses the growing importance of global franchise leagues like the WBBL and The Hundred for players who are not currently in the national team setup.

Special Report: Analysis of Recent ODI Match and Batting MilestonesThis special report covers a recent One Day International cricket match in Ranchi, highlighting a record-breaking partnership between two senior batters. The discussion analyses their centuries and half-centuries, which set a formidable target for the opposition. The speaker explores the players' fitness transformations and their strategic importance for the upcoming 2027 World Cup. The report also addresses speculation regarding their future in the team and the necessity of consistent performances in the ODI format.

Treesa-Gayatri defend women's doubles crown, Srikanth suffers heartbreakIndia wrapped up the Syed Modi International Super 300 with mixed fortunes on Sunday, as Treesa Jolly and Gayatri Gopichand stylishly defended their women's doubles crown, while Kidambi Srikanth's long title drought extended after a heartbreaking three-game defeat in the men's singles final.

Virat Kohli or Sachin Tendulkar: Gavaskar picks his greatest ODI batterSunil Gavaskar hailed Virat Kohli as the greatest ODI batter after his 52nd hundred in Ranchi, saying even Ricky Ponting calls him the best he has seen and that surpassing Sachin Tendulkar leaves Kohli at the very top.

Rohit Sharma's expletive-laden celebration of Virat Kohli's century goes viralIndia vs South Africa: Former India captain Rohit Sharma's raw and unfiltered reaction to Virat Kohli's record-extending 52nd century during the first ODI against South Africa in Ranchi went viral.

Special Report: Indian Batters Smash Records in ODI Match Against South AfricaThis special report provides coverage of an ODI cricket match between India and South Africa. The broadcast highlights a significant century scored by a top-order Indian batter, marking a major milestone in his career. It also details a record-breaking performance by the team captain, who surpassed a long-standing record for the most sixes in the format. The segment describes a 136-run partnership between the two senior players and notes the dismissal of one batter by a South African pacer. The report concludes with an update on the match situation as the centurion continues his innings.

Rohit Sharma Breaks Shahid Afridi's All-Time Record for Most ODI Sixes in RanchiOn this Special Report, the focus is on the 1st ODI between India and South Africa in Ranchi. Rohit Sharma has created history by breaking Shahid Afridi's long-standing record for the most sixes in ODI cricket. The 'Hitman' achieved this feat while batting alongside Virat Kohli, with the duo—dubbed 'Roko'—looking to dominate. Stand-in captain KL Rahul leads the side in the absence of injured regulars. South Africa won the toss and opted to bowl first in this crucial series opener.

Virat Kohli fan evades security, falls at his feet interrupting hundred celebrationVirat Kohli scored his 52nd ODI century during the first match against South Africa in Ranchi. A pitch invader interrupted his century celebration by falling at his feet.

Virat Kohli coming for 2027 World Cup: Ranchi hundred leaves fans in aweVirat Kohli's 52nd ODI hundred in Ranchi sparked a massive reaction from former cricketers and fans, with many already backing him for the 2027 ODI World Cup after a composed, vintage knock that showcased his hunger and dominance.

The broadcast highlights a significant century scored by a top-order Indian batter, marking a major milestone in his career. It also details a record-breaking performance by the team captain, who surpassed a long-standing record for the most sixes in the format. The segment describes a 136-run partnership between the two senior players and notes the dismissal of one batter by a South African pacer. Virat Kohli coming for 2027 World Cup: Ranchi hundred leaves fans in aweVirat Kohli's 52nd ODI hundred in Ranchi sparked a massive reaction from former cricketers and fans, with many already backing him for the 2027 ODI World Cup after a composed, vintage knock that showcased his hunger and dominance.

IND vs SA: Vintage Virat Kohli continues Ranchi love affair, hits 52nd ODI hundredVirat Kohli pulled off an absolute classic in the ODI series opener against South Africa, smashing his 52nd ODI hundred. He extends his stellar record in Ranchi as he helped India put up a formidable first-innings total.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma to come out of Test retirement? Pietersen reacts to rumoursKevin Pietersen has called on the BCCI to seriously consider Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli returning to Test cricket. Their comeback is seen as crucial for the survival of Test cricket in India after recent series losses.

Virat Kohli asked to come out of Test retirement? BCCI reacts to rumoursRumours are rife in the media that BCCI are looking to approach Virat Kohli for a Test return. BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia spoke to Aajtak and reacted to the speculation.

Watch: Dewald Brevis takes a stunner to dismiss Ruturaj GaikwadIndia vs South Africa, 1st ODI: Dewald Brevis pulled off a breathtaking one-handed diving catch at backward point to dismiss Ruturaj Gaikwad for 8 off 14 balls.

Shah Rukh Khan pays Andre Russell tribute, explains new KKR Power Coach roleKKR owner Shah Rukh Khan paid a glowing tribute to Andre Russell as the West Indies all-rounder decided to retire from IPL on Sunday, November 30. Shah Rukh also explained the new Power Coach role for Russell at KKR.

IND vs SA: Rohit Sharma breaks Shahid Afridi's world record for most ODI sixesRohit Sharma broke the world record for most sixes in ODI cricket during the first match against South Africa at Ranchi. He surpassed Shahid Afridi after smashing three sixes during his innings.

Virat Kohli-Rohit Sharma Jodi India's most capped as records tumble in Ranchi ODIVirat Kohli and Rohit Sharma became the most-capped pairing for India in international cricket, going past the record set by Sachin Tendulkar and Rahul Dravid. Kohli also went past Jacques Kallis in the most runs list in India vs South Africa ODIs.

SMAT: India outcasts Ishan Kishan, Abhimanyu Easwaran slam breathtaking centuriesIshan Kishan and Abhimanyu Easwaran both scored centuries in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2025–26. While Kishan's innings helped Jharkhand secure a convincing win, Easwaran's valiant knock went in vain for Bengal.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
